body: @lberki Do you think this is doable only for git_repository?

I'm not entirely sure what "only for `git_repository`" means, but it looks like `git_worker.bzl` calls out to the `git` command line tool, so it should be implementable in `git_repository()` and `git_override` uses that, so I think the answer to you question is "yes"?
Yes, the scope is much smaller than adding native support of git sparse-checkout in Bazel. So contribution is welcome!

issue.title: Enable sparse checkout in git_repository rule

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Add a sparse_checkout_patterns argument to the git_repository rule. If non-empty, this will cause the rule to perform a sparse checkout of the repository, only checking out files that match the .gitignore-style patterns in this list.

Fixes issue #24069.

issue.title: [8.2.0] Enable sparse checkout in git_repository rule

milestone.title: 8.2.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.2.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Add a sparse_checkout_patterns and sparse_checkout_file arguments to the git_repository rule. If non-empty, this will cause the rule to perform a sparse checkout of the repository, only checking out files that match the .gitignore-style patterns in this list.

Fixes issue https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/24069.

Cherry-pick of https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/4006e059737d214fc4116083d9c4e58d5a2e40c0

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.2.0 RC3](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.2.0rc3). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.2.0rc3. Thanks!
